private_information: I hold disks A,B,C,D,E,F,G with A smallest on top and G largest at bottom
left_peg.goal: Contribute to achieving the final configuration where all disks are on the right peg in correct order

middle_peg.goal: Contribute to achieving the final configuration where all disks are on the right peg in correct order

right_peg.goal: Contribute to achieving the final configuration where all disks are on the right peg in correct order

orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward solver that achieves the goal of moving all disks from left peg to right peg following Tower of Hanoi rules

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left middle and right
There are seven disks labelled A B C D E F G from smallest A to largest G
Only one disk can be moved at a time
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Initial configuration has left peg top to bottom A B C D E F G and the other pegs empty
Goal configuration has right peg top to bottom A B C D E F G and the other pegs empty

model.system_prompt: You are the left peg agent. Describe your local state and the legal single disk moves you can initiate. Report the list of disks you hold from top to bottom and enumerate which peg destinations are valid for the top disk given the puzzle rules. Do not produce PDDL. Keep the response concise and factual.
model.prompt: Your name is left_peg. You have the following private information about your local state and role in the puzzle: {agents->left_peg->private_information}. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. Describe clearly the disks currently on your peg from top to bottom and the legal moves you can initiate for the top disk given the rules. Do not produce PDDL.

model.system_prompt: You are the middle peg agent. Describe your local state and the legal single disk moves you can accept or initiate. Report the list of disks you hold from top to bottom and state when you can receive a disk based on size constraints. Do not produce PDDL. Keep the response concise and factual.
model.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. You have the following private information about your local state and role in the puzzle: {agents->middle_peg->private_information}. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. Describe clearly the disks currently on your peg from top to bottom and the legal moves you can accept or initiate given the rules. Do not produce PDDL.

model.system_prompt: You are the right peg agent. Describe your local state and the legal single disk moves you can accept. Report the list of disks you hold from top to bottom and explain when you can receive the top disk of another peg. Do not produce PDDL. Keep the response concise and factual.
model.prompt: Your name is right_peg. You have the following private information about your local state and role in the puzzle: {agents->right_peg->private_information}. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. Describe clearly the disks currently on your peg from top to bottom and the legal moves you can accept given the rules. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL modeling and in preparing inputs for the FastDownward planner. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a corresponding PDDL problem that represent the Tower of Hanoi instance described. The domain must encode legal moves that transfer a single top disk between pegs while preventing larger disks on smaller ones. Use the pegs named left middle and right and the disks A B C D E F G. Target the FastDownward solver and ensure the PDDL is compatible with common FastDownward parsers. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Provide no additional text outside those tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive local state descriptions from the three peg agents. Here are their reported models or observations. Use them to create a single consistent PDDL domain and problem that solves the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Input from left peg: {model_left}. Input from middle peg: {model_middle}. Input from right peg: {model_right}. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward solver. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not include other commentary.
